result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dennis A. Trepania was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.
